TypeSignature.Value: public class RestrictionEntry : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RestrictionEntry extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Applications can expose restrictions for a restricted user on a multiuser device.

remarks.para: Applications can expose restrictions for a restricted user on a multiuser device. The administrator can configure these restrictions that will then be applied to the restricted user. Each RestrictionsEntry is one configurable restriction.

Any application that chooses to expose such restrictions does so by implementing a receiver that handles the action. The receiver then returns a result bundle that contains an entry called "restrictions", whose value is an ArrayList.

Returns the provided user-visible description of the entry, if any.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetChoiceEntries(string[] choiceEntries) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets a list of strings that will be presented as choices to the user.

remarks.para: Sets a list of strings that will be presented as choices to the user. When the user selects one or more of these choices, the corresponding value from the possible values are stored as the selected strings. The size of this array must match the size of the array set in . This method is not relevant for types other than , and .

Docs.param: an array of Strings which will be the selected values for the user's selections.
Docs.summary: Sets a list of string values that can be selected by the user, similar to .

remarks.para: Sets a list of string values that can be selected by the user. If no user-visible entries are set by a call to , these values will be the ones shown to the user. Values will be chosen from this list as the user's selection and the selected values can be retrieved by a call to , or , depending on whether it is a multi-select type or choice type. This method is not relevant for types other than , and .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: A type of restriction.

remarks.para: A type of restriction. Use this for presenting a multi-select list where more than one entry can be selected, such as for choosing specific titles to white-list. Call and to set the localized list entries to present to the user and the corresponding values, respectively. Use and to manipulate the selections.

remarks.para: A type of restriction. Use this type for information that needs to be transferred across but shouldn't be presented to the user in the UI. Stores a single String value.
